definitions.definition: go in a specified direction or manner; change position.
examples: she stood up and moved to the door
synonyms: change position "she moved to the door"

definitions.definition: change the place or position of.
examples: she moved the tray to a side table
synonyms: shift "he moved the chair closer to the fire"

definitions.definition: change one's place of residence or work.
examples: his family moved to London when he was a child
synonyms: pull up stakes "she's moved to Rotterdam"

definitions.definition: (of a player) change the position of a piece in a board game.
examples: White has forced his opponent to move

definitions.definition: change or cause to change from one state, opinion, sphere, or activity to another.
examples: the school moved over to the new course in 1987
synonyms: have second thoughts; Moremake a U-turn
do an about-face "they are not prepared to move on this issue"

definitions.definition: influence or prompt (someone) to do something.
examples: his deep love of music moved him to take lessons with Dr. Hill

definitions.definition: take action.
examples: hard-liners may yet move against him, but their success might be limited
synonyms: take measures; informalget moving "he urged the council to move quickly"

definitions.definition: provoke a strong feeling, especially of sorrow or sympathy, in.
examples: he was moved to tears by a get-well message from the president

definitions.definition: stir up (an emotion) in someone.
examples: he justly moves one's derision
synonyms: make an impression on "I was deeply moved by the story"

definitions.definition: make progress; develop in a particular manner or direction.
examples: aircraft design had moved forward a long way

definitions.definition: depart; start off.
examples: let's move—it's time we started shopping

definitions.definition: used to urge or command someone to hurry up.
examples: come on—move it!

definitions.definition: go quickly.
examples: Kenny was really moving when he made contact with a tire at the hairpin and flipped over

definitions.definition: (with reference to merchandise) sell or be sold.
examples: despite the high prices, goods are moving

definitions.definition: spend one's time or be socially active in (a particular sphere) or among (a particular group of people).
examples: they moved in different circles of friends
synonyms: associate; informalhang out/around "she moves in the art world"

definitions.definition: propose for discussion and resolution at a meeting or legislative assembly.
examples: she intends to move an amendment to the bill

definitions.definition: make a formal request or application to (a court or assembly) for something.
examples: his family moved the court for adequate “maintenance expenses” to run the household

definitions.definition: empty (one's bowels).
a change of place, position, or state.
examples: she made a sudden move toward me
synonyms: gesticulation "his eyes followed her every move"

definitions.definition: a change of house or business premises.
examples: relocation, change of address, transfer, posting his recent move to Sarasota

definitions.definition: an action that initiates or advances a process or plan.
examples: my next move is to talk to Matthew
synonyms: stratagem "the latest move in the war against drugs"

definitions.definition: a maneuver in a sport or game.
a change of position of a piece in a board game.
examples: that move will put your king in check

definitions.definition: a player's turn to make a change of position.
examples: it's your move
